title: December 31
description:
So here we all find ourselves at the end of the year. Hi!

Taking stock:

  • Felix started speaking French, rides a bike without training wheels, and has made a solid start at reading.
  • Milo ditched the diapers (yaaaaaay!), found a gift for learning songs, and graduated from a trike to a bike with training wheels. Oh yeah: he started talking in complete sentences. Jeez, was that really this year!?
  • The company that Dean co-founded last year, Widgetbox, grew from to 10 to 21 people and so far the gray hairs seem natural rather than stress-related.
  • Lucie achieved an enviable work/life balance, being there for the kids and managing to take the entire month of August off, yet still able to pick and choose her gigs for fun and profit.
  • Both Dean and Lucie managed to maintain their girlish figures.

To celebrate an excellent year, we went to our friend Andrew's house for New Year's eve, where Lucie participated in an Iron Chef Competition. Here's the pix.

children.title: Best Effort
children.description: This is the best we could do for a year-end photo of all four of us.  We tried.  Hard.

children.title: Inspiration Point
children.description: Somehow it always ends up that the last few days of the year are gorgeous.  This is Inspiration Point, in Tilden park.

children.title: The Twins
children.description:
Over the long vacation we've been having lots of playdates and sleepovers.

The identical twins Addison and Parker are, perhaps not surprisingly, great at sharing tasks: "You do the top half, I'll do the bottom."

children.title: The Sneetches
children.description: Bedtime with Addison and Parker and one of Dean's favorite books, <cite>The Sneetches</cite>.

children.title: Harry Potter
children.description:
Reading Harry Potter over mugs of tea and warm milk.

We just finished the second book and learned the secret of the Chamber of Secrets!

children.title: Iron Reader
children.description:
New Year Eve. At a party. Everybody wants to know what's going to happen next.

All the adults (other than Dean) were watching Lucie kick croissant in the Iron Chef competition.

children.title: Addicted
children.description: Milo's getting sucked into the computer.  Felix so far hasn't felt the siren call.

children.title: Iron Chef
children.description:
Every New Year's Eve our friend Andrew hosts an Iron Chef competition. It's modeled after the eponymous TV show.

Two teams of chefs compete. The goal? Prepare the tastiest, best-presented and most original dishes possible in a mere hour's time. Each dish must make use of the "secret ingredient", which is revealed with much ceremony at the start of the competition.

Go back to December 31, 2007.

children.title: Electric Mirror
children.description: Watching a video of their own monkeyshines.
